clinical_study.brief_title: Characterization of Post-operative Pain Trajectories Over Seven Days and Links With Chronicity
clinical_study.official_title: Characterization of Post-operative Pain Trajectories Over Seven Days and Their Potential Links With Chronicity After 3 Months: a Single-center, Prospective, Pilot Cohort Study at the Nîmes University Hospital

detailed_description.textblock:
The secondary objectives of this study are:
A. To assess the incidence of Post-Surgical Chronic Pain (PSCP) Chronic 3 months post intervention.
B. To asses the incidence of neuropathic type pain (DN4 Questionnaire) at 3 months post intervention.
C. To study the potential links between pain trajectories and the presence or absence of PSCP.
D. To study the potential links between the presence or absence of PSCP and known risk factors for PSCP (patient-related data, data on the surgery, anesthesia data).

primary_outcome.measure: The pain trajectory for the first 7 post-operative days.
primary_outcome.description: The pain trajectory is the vector of 7 verbal numerical pain estimates (from 0 to 10) taken over 7 days (days 1 (or -1), 2, 3, 4, 5, 6 & 7). Day 0 is the day of surgery.

secondary_outcome.measure: Since the surgery, do you have persistent pain? yes/no
Is it the same pain before the surgery? yes/no
Verbal numberical scale for pain (ranging from 0 to 10)
Have you had complications from your surgery? yes/no

arm_group.description: The study population consists of adult surgery patients at the Nîmes University Hospital, with recruitment based on the operating theater program for a predefined six month period and for a predefined list of surgeries. The latter list of surgical acts was established according to the Medicalization of Information Systems Progam (PMSI) database. Patients are recruited either the day before or the day after surgery, in their respective departments. Interventions: In hospital pain evaluation In hospital questionnaires Telephone conctact at 3 months

intervention.description: Patients will be contacted at 3 months post-surgery for pain questionnaires.
Patients will evaluate their pain levels via a verbal numerical scale on days 1(or-1), 2, 3, 4, 5, 6 & 7.
Patients are required to fill out the HADS and PCS questionnaires between on day -1 or +1.

study_pop.textblock: The study population consists of adult surgery patients at the Nîmes University Hospital, with recruitment based on the operating theater program for a predefined six month period and for a predefined list of surgeries. The latter list of surgical acts was established according to the Medicalization of Information Systems Progam (PMSI) database. Patients are recruited either the day before or the day after surgery, in their respective departments.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- The patient must be insured or beneficiary of a health insurance plan
- The patient is available for 3 months of follow-up
- The patient has undergone a planned surgical procedure in one of the participating departments
- The patient is willing and able to respond to the study questionnaires (HADS, PCS, EN, DN4)
Exclusion Criteria:
- The patient is participating in another study
- The patient is in an exclusion period determined by a previous study
- The patient is under judicial protection, under tutorship or curatorship
- It is impossible to correctly inform the patient
- Patient admitted to the ICU and still intubated at day 1
